intro: Cissampelos acuta, commonly known as the sharpleaf moonvine, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
